findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The smart contract owner can change the buy and sell fees without any threshold set.

findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The smart contract owner can explicitly airdrop tokens to specified wallets without any limit, allowing minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected constructor
findings.description: The constructor of a contract is unprotected, allowing anyone to call it and potentially alter the contract's state.

findings.title: Unprotected receive ether function
findings.description: The contract has a function that allows it to receive Ether without any protection or validation, making it vulnerable to unauthorized transactions.

findings.title: Unprotected setProtection function
findings.description: The setProtection function is unprotected and can be accessed by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected disableProtection function
findings.description: The disableProtection function is unprotected and can be called by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected transfer function
findings.description: The _transferFrom function does not have any protection mechanism, allowing unauthorized transfers.

findings.title: Unprotected transferFrom function
findings.description: The transferFrom function is unprotected and can be exploited by non-whitelisted wallets to transfer a specified number of tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected setLiquidityProvider function
findings.description: The setLiquidityProvider function lacks access control, allowing anyone to call it and potentially manipulate the liquidity provider.

findings.title: Unprotected launch function
findings.description: The launch function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential exploitation.

findings.title: Unprotected setTxLimit function
findings.description: The setTxLimit function is unprotected and can be accessed by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized changes to transaction limits.

findings.title: Unprotected setMaxWallet function
findings.description: The setMaxWallet function is external and lacks access control, allowing anyone to call it.
